resources.string: Good Craft Beers and Local Spirits
Interesting Choice of Beers and Great Location
Large Selection of Martinis and Seasonal Cocktails

City Park Pool is located in City Park. Enjoy the park surroundings and Sheldon Lake for fishing and an outdoor pool. City Park Pool is the best place to be during those hot summer days in Fort Collins. City Park Pool provides you with a water park experience right in your own backyard. Admission is charged for everyone entering City Park Pool.

Six and one-half miles of water beckon visitors to come out and play! Surrounded by 1,900 acres of public lands, this reservoir has it all: fishing, boating, camping, picnicking, swimming, scuba diving, rock climbing, and water skiing.

The Annual Flower Trial Garden is a horticultural project at the Colorado State University in Fort Collins. Every year, the project sees new varietals of different flowers planted in the garden to assess their ability to develop and grow in the local climate, as well as their flowering characteristics. Open to public and free of charge.

The scenic 2,711-acre Horsetooth Mountain Open Space (consisting of Culver, Soderberg, and Hughey Open Spaces) covers elevations from 5,430 to 7,255 feet. Its 29 miles of hiking, biking, and horseback riding trails connect to the Blue Sky Trail and Lory State Park trails. The outstanding Horsetooth Rock is a familiar local landmark visible from the plains.

Mountain Whitewater Descents is a guide company offering whitewater rafting trips on Cache La Poudre River, equipment rentals and a pub. It prides itself on its special permit for using the river, which is the only "Wild and Scenic" river near Fort Collins and Estes Park, offering the best wilderness rafting experience.

The only place in Fort Collins serving some amazing fondues, with the choice of heated pots of cheese, chocolate or broth for dipping and cooking. For the adventurous, local favorites also occupy a sizable portion of the menu. Waiters are friendly and helpful and they help you decide the food befitting your palate. Make reservations ahead of time.

Enjoy many delightful authentic Afghan recipes with savory flavors and mouth watering smells brought straight from the heart of Afghanistan. Locally owned and operated. Serving Fort Collins for more than 5 years!

The "Start of it All" - Fort Collins is the original Rio. Located in the heart of Old Town, The Rio has become a popular destination for locals, students, and tourists to enjoy fresh Tex Mex and legendary margaritas.

North Indian craft kitchen featuring local and international ingredients cooked fresh to order keeping you in mind! Dine in/take out. The owners of this fine establishment believe that spicy does not translate to "being hot". This is a go-to place for all indian food cravers and others who like to occasionally get a refreshing taste of indian flavors.

Amazing beignets, fantastic chicory coffee and other bayou-rific Cajun-Creole staples mark this area chain, where the rich and flavorful breakfast fare and awesome brunch are what fans expect when they go to heaven; the cozy, homey digs capture New Orleans, but get there early on weekends or prepare to bump elbows.

Delicious hot food, super fast service, awesome prices. Consistently on point every visit. Chicken, falafel, and souvlaki gyros are incredibly good for the price. Local favorite is the fries - double fried, nice and crispy, and perfectly salted. So good! Service is also pleasantly friendly for a busy greek restaurant.

Truly authentic Thai place in Ft Collins. If you are looking for fresh, authentic and traditional Thai food, this place is as good as you will find. Unbelievable flavor and spice that you won\'t find at most Thai or Asian cuisine restaurants. Chicken Cashew is a must try. You either will feel something entirely new or it may transport you back home.

Free tour, getting to see behind the bottles of your favorite beer? Priceless. The tour is fun!! Completely different brewery tour experience. Its a little more than a hour tour with loads of new information about the process of beer brewing and get to learn all this in a fun way.

Odell breweries, is a gorgeous taproom just outside downtown Ft. Collins. There\'s ample space to sip and socialize both inside and out, as well as a great little section of souvenirs so tourists can bring back a memento of their visit. Bar service is friendly and efficient, and the there\'s a food counter along with a stage for local entertainment.

The brewery tour is an immersive experience where you can hear, smell, touch and taste the components that go into some of the world’s most popular beers. Additionally, Fort Collins is the home to the world-famous Budweiser Clydesdales West Coast Team. You can get an up-close and personal encounter and have your picture taken with these iconic horses!

Welcome to World-Famous CooperSmith\’s Pub and Brewing. Tucked into the heart of Old Town Fort Collins, CooperSmith\’s offers a distinct alternative in eating and drinking establishments. We invite you to enjoy our unique charm. Located across the walkway from CooperSmith\’s Pubside, Poolside offers not only additional brewery space but an upscale yet casual atmosphere.

Social is a locally-owned, underground, cocktail bar in Old Town Fort Collins. It\'s a place to enjoy properly crafted cocktails, sommelier selected wines, and abundantly sliced charcuterie. At the entrance into Old Town Square, a street clock and a well-lit stairwell welcome you to an evening filled with great conversation. Friendly service and great quality food and beverage.

Named one of the nation\'s top 100 beer bars, the Mayor of Old Town has 100 beers on tap and a passionate staff that\'ll help you find your ideal brew. Good food menu at a reasonable price, they really have a lot to choose from. This beer oasis is very close to Colorado State University campus and is in downtown Fort Collins area.

Best place for Sliders and Poutine and Beer. It is right down the street from CSU, a nice patio out front and lot of Colorado memorabilia inside creates a funky place to hang out and get some good food and beer. Service is fantastic and friendly all around.

Step away from one world and descend underground into another – a shadowy, smoldering enclave with walls nearly a century old that hold the memories and merriment of travelers and the surrounding neighborhood alike. Sip a handcrafted martini from our signature drink menu, or partake in that perfect pairing of wine and unforgettable fare.

Cooking up inventive concoctions you could only dream of comes naturally to the talented bartenders at this marvelous Fort Collins martini bar that\'s both chic (huge windows and secluded booths) and chill (films projected on the wall); tabs are reasonable for what you\'re getting and the atmosphere\'s perfect for either a group outing or a date, keeping it a must-stop for many.
